New Records: This is the first time the top 4 of any team have all got fifty in ODI World Cups
Key Match Events: KL Rahul scored a 62-ball century, eventually falling for 102 off 64 balls
Shreyas Iyer remained unbeaten on 128 off 95 balls
Teja Nidamanuru hit six sixes to score a quickfire 54 off 39 balls
Virat Kohli took his first ODI wicket since 2014
Rohit Sharma bowled for the first time since 2006
Kuldeep Yadav and Ravindra Jadeja took key wickets to restrict Netherlands
Mohammed Siraj struck early in the second innings
India reached 410/4, their second-highest World Cup score
Pre-Game Insights: India captain Rohit Sharma won the toss and chose to bat
Both teams fielded unchanged XIs from their previous matches
Netherlands needed a win to qualify for the next big ICC ODI tournament
Post-Match Reflections: India finished the league stage with a perfect 9-0 record
The Netherlands showed batting grit against a strong Indian attack
Rohit Sharma expressed satisfaction with the team's performance and readiness for the semi-final against New Zealand
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in Bengaluru on November 12, 2023
The crowd enjoyed light moments with bowling spells from Kohli, Gill, and Suryakumar Yadav
Mohammed Siraj got hit on the throat while dropping a catch but returned to the field
